revised_title: Finite Distortional Latent Hardening in Single Crystals: A Mathematical Theory
tldr: The authors propose a simple mathematical theory of finite distortional latent hardening in single crystals, accounting for the perpetuation of single slip beyond the symmetry line in the tensile test of f.c.c. crystals. The theory reduces to Taylor's rule at infinitesimal strain and predicts fully anisotropic finite-distortional hardening of latent slip systems, in qualitative agreement with experimental findings.
